titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 13-14 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1824 Nov. 13-14
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt features summaries of the first two court sessions of 1825, Thursday October 13 and Friday October 14. On both days, court was adjourned without any cases being heard.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Thursday 13.
div.p:
Court convened agreeable to adjournment, from the 11th of November last. Present their Honors John Martin, James Daniel, Richard Walker, and James Brown, Circuit Court Judges, Jurors Daniel Griffin Foreman, Thomas Saunders, The Chip, Suttoowocke
George Saunders, Deer in the Water, Wahachee being absent, Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock

div.head: Friday 14th
div.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment Present their Honors John Martin &C et cetera Part of the Jurors being absent, Court is adjourned untill tomorrow 10 Oclock
